job_description: PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER COOPAbout the JobDivision: Broadband Wireless DivisionAPPLY WITH RESUME AND TRANSCRIPT TO JOB # 1089515001As a co-op in the Broadband Wireless group, you will work on developing PMC-Sierra’s next generation of wireless IC products.  This will involve taking a design from initial concept to production form. Throughout your co-op term you will work beside experienced engineers and be exposed to PMC-Sierra’s Best-In-Class engineering practices.Job ResponsibilitiesYou will be responsible for design and/ or verification of digital integrated circuits at the block level or top level of a device. Responsibilities could include contributing to the investigation of a device feature set, designing and/ or verifying device features, performing development activities such as Formal Verification, Design for Testability and Static Timing Analysis.
job_requirements: Job Qualifications:• Currently enrolled in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering• CGPA >3.0• Strong interest in and familiar with wireless data communications theory and systems• Proficient in VHDL and/or Verilog• Experience in designing, implementing and verifying VHDL or Verilog based designs• Familiarity with design and verification practices; Static Timing Analysis is an asset• Matlab experience is an asset• Experience with FPGAs.• Good programming / scripting skills with languages such as Python, Tcl, Awk, C and Perl• Excellent analytical, communication and documentation skills• Previous co-op experience is an assetOpen To All Majors:No
